text: Does anyone know if you were to move an image from one folder to another, do the site links update automatically or do I need to go in and update the image path to the new location?
image was moved, site shows it still but not sure if its caching from HS
I’ve never run into an issue with it, I’ve assumed HS auto-populates forwarding links.
<@U2H3TT8F2|ajlaporte> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/ajlaporte/F4JNZ66NM/pasted_image_at_2017_03_16_11_38_am.png|Pasted image at 2017-03-16, 11:38 AM>
to be clear, we create a redirect from the old location to the new one. We don’t update the links on the pages themselves

Question for the group. We are looking to set a client's blog to a sortable format. For example filter results based on selection. We had a solution working, but hit a snag when we went to page two. Does anyone know how to hold the filtered results from page to page? Is this possible?
<@U22PJPGK0> so is it safe to say I will have to go into the page where I originally linked the item and update the image to the new file path?
no. The link on the page will redirect to the new location
well it may not actually look like a redirect to you, but it will use the version from the new location
